definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
carer of elderly persons/aged care worker

sentences.english: Only one of them old, the hill that was nearest to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 只有一位年老者，在离天堂最近的山坡上。

sentences.english: He admired the old man for his crafty plan.
sentences.chinese: 他敬佩老者的神机妙算。

sentences.english: When they arrived at dryland, the elder went his own way.
sentences.chinese: 当他们到达一片陆地时，老者又独自赶路了。

sentences.english: The whole of the club turnedinstinctively, waiting to hear what the old man had tosay;
sentences.chinese: 全俱乐部的人都本能地转过脸，等着听这位老者开讲。

sentences.english: Why can the old man stare at the sun but keep healthy without eating or drinking?
sentences.chinese: 为什么这个老者却能因此可以不吃不喝？

sentences.english: In the young one, bowing to the older one, I recognized myself.
sentences.chinese: 那位少年在给老者鞠躬，我认出那就是我本人。

sentences.english: Sat by the window of the old man, was gazing out the window the stream of people.
sentences.chinese: 坐在窗口的老者，正凝视着窗外川流的人群。

sentences.english: Savage beasts devoured innocent people; vicious birds preyed on the weak and old.
sentences.chinese: 野兽吞吃天真的人，堕落的鸟类在捕食老者和弱者。

sentences.english: If you wish good advice consult an old man.
Several scholars and carers with a boat ride.
sentences.chinese: 几个学者与一个老者同船共渡。

sentences.english: The old man rambled about the past.
The face of disaster stricken old man, in the eyes of philosophers is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 面对饱经灾难的老者，在哲人的眼里是美的。

sentences.english: I heard an older sounding chap with a golden voice.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一位有着一把好嗓子的老者在说话。

sentences.english: The old man stood there and dithered.
sentences.chinese: 那老者站在那儿直发抖。

sentences.english: The old man has lain sick in bed for years.
sentences.chinese: 那老者病卧于床好些年了。

sentences.english: Bitterness surname the old is also spirit thump a beard to stare ah, bad shriek.
sentences.chinese: 苦姓老者更是气得吹胡子瞪呀，就差哇哇叫起来。

definition: purple qipao gown, the sign of an official position
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
black clothes/servant (old)/young woman role in Chinese opera, also called 正旦[zheng4 dan4]
elder/term of respect for a Buddhist monk
honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)
